{{cpp/experimental/ranges/title|Constructible}}
{{cpp/experimental/ranges/concepts/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=experimental/ranges/concepts|since=ranges|1=
template&lt; class T, class... Args &gt;
concept bool Constructible =
    Destructible&lt;T&gt; &amp;&amp; std::is_constructible&lt;T, Args...&gt;::value;
}}

The {{tt|Constructible}} concept specifies that a variable of type {{tt|T}} can be initialized with the given set of argument types {{tt|Args...}}.

There need not be any subsumption relationship between {{tt|Constructible&lt;T, Args...&gt;}} and {{c|std::is_constructible&lt;T, Args...&gt;::value}}.
